intro: Potentilla szovitsii, commonly known as the Szovits' cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are palmately divided into five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Potentilla szovitsii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions.
